explanation:
code_hardening: Added a null check for txt to avoid processing invalid input, treated salt defensively by checking for non-blank values, marked parameters as final, and explicitly specified UTF-8 when converting the string to bytes.
resolve_compilation_errors: Updated the method signature to include the salt parameter and aligned it with existing direct callers; used fully qualified names for StandardCharsets and StringUtils to avoid import issues.
exception_handling: Preserved the existing try-catch structure and NoSuchAlgorithmException handling, with unchanged return semantics.
logic_customization: Appended salt to the input text only when StringUtils.isNotBlank(salt) evaluates to true; ensured the algorithm parameter supports MD5, SHA1, and SHA-256 while keeping hashing and hex encoding logic identical.
refactoring: Updated Javadoc to document the new salt parameter and expanded supported algorithms, and clarified naming by referring to the hashing parameter as algorithm.
misc: Minor documentation and formatting updates only; no additional custom API calls beyond org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils.isNotBlank(String).
